item.title: L4 - Geometric Sequences
item.description: Notes What is a geometric sequence? A geometric sequence is a sequence in which the ratio between two consecutive terms is constant. We can always multiply/divide the same value to find the next term.

item.title: L6 - Recursive Sequences
item.description: Notes What is a Recursive Sequence? A Recursive Sequence is a sequence where the value of one term is based upon the previous terms of the sequence. Recursive Formula Formula that permits us to calculate a term, using the previous terms of the sequence Fibonacci Sequence The Fibonacci Sequence is a recursive sequence with the equation of: In general there are 3 components to a recursive formula The beginning terms A formula Restrictions Restrictions does not go below 1 For a lot of Recursive Sequences you will need restrictions.

item.title: Lesson 1 - Simple and Compound Interest
item.description: 1. Simple Interest Interest is accumulated only on the principal amount. or Where: = Final amount = Principal amount = Interest rate (in decimal form) = Time Example 1: Investing $250 in an account that pays 5% simple interest per year for 5 years.

item.title: Lesson 2 - The Future Value of an Annuity
item.description: Notes What is an Ordinary Annuity? An Ordinary Annuity is a type of investment where equal payments are made at regular intervals over time. Example For example, at the end of each month, a regular payment is made into a savings account.
